DataElement.preferredName: Urothelial Carcinoma Bladder Histologic Confirmation Diagnosis Most Recent Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The most recent date related to a histologically confirmed diagnosis of urothelial carcinoma of the bladder.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Urothelial Carcinoma Bladder Histologic Confirmation Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from the transitional epithelium of the urinary tract (urinary bladder, ureter, urethra, or renal pelvis). It is frequently papillary._The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._Having been established or verified._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from the transitional epithelium of the urinary tract (urinary bladder, ureter, urethra, or renal pelvis).  It is frequently papillary. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the urothelial lining of the urinary tract (bladder, renal pelvis, ureter, or urethra).

Property.preferredDefinition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.:Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.:Having been established or verified.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.
Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the most recent date of an event, assessment, or treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Nearest to the present time.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
